DataElement.preferredName: Histologically Confirmed Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma Prior Chemotherapy Failure at least 3 Month Disease-Free Survival Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator to signify the presence of histologically confirmed Head and Neck squamous cell carcinoma with prior chemotherapy failure with at least a 3 month disease free interval.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Histologically Confirmed Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma Prior Chemotherapy Failure at least 3 Month Disease-Free Survival
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Involving the use of histology or histological techniques._Confirmed; having been established or verified._A squamous cell carcinoma that arises from any of the following anatomic sites: lip and oral cavity, nasal cavity, paranasal sinuses, pharynx, larynx, and salivary glands._Previous chemotherapy administered as treatment for this cancer._loss of ability to function normally._A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::3_One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar.  It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks._Period after successful treatment in which there is no appearance of the symptoms or effects of the disease.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Histologically Confirmed Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma Prior Chemotherapy Failure
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Involving the use of histology or histological techniques.:Confirmed; having been established or verified.:A squamous cell carcinoma that arises from any of the following anatomic sites: lip and oral cavity, nasal cavity, paranasal sinuses, pharynx, larynx, and salivary glands.:Previous chemotherapy administered as treatment for this cancer.:loss of ability to function normally.

Concepts.definition: Involving the use of histology or histological techniques.

Concepts.longName: Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma
Concepts.definition: A squamous cell carcinoma that arises from any of the following anatomic sites: lip and oral cavity, nasal cavity, paranasal sinuses, pharynx, larynx, and salivary glands.
Previous chemotherapy administered as treatment for this cancer.
A lack of occurrence or performance.

Property.preferredName: Greater Than or Equal To Integer::3 Month Disease-Free Survival
Property.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::3:One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar.  It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.:Period after successful treatment in which there is no appearance of the symptoms or effects of the disease.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.
The length of time after treatment for a specific disease during which a patient survives with no sign of recurrence of the disease.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ReferenceDocuments.name: Subject with prior histologic
ReferenceDocuments.description: Subject with prior histologically confirmed advanced squamous-cell carcinoma of the head and neck that failed prior traditional chemoradiotherapy with at least a 3-month disease-free interval from the completion of the initial curative treatment.
